bayou.http

Class HttpResponseImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.http.HttpResponseImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Async<HttpResponse>, AutoAsync<HttpResponse>, HttpResponse

    public class HttpResponseImpl
extends Object
implements HttpResponse, AutoAsync<HttpResponse>
    A mutable implementation of HttpResponse.

    An HttpResponseImpl can be modified after construction, e.g. by header(String, String). These mutation methods return `this` for method chaining.

    Many static methods in HttpResponse return HttpResponseImpl objects, on which the caller can make further modifications.

    HttpResponseImpl is a subtype of Async<HttpResponse>; it can be returned from HttpHandler.handle(HttpRequest); it can be invoked with Async methods like .then().

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpResponseImpl

        public HttpResponseImpl(HttpStatus status,
                        HttpEntity entity)
        Create an http response.

      • HttpResponseImpl

        public HttpResponseImpl(HttpResponse originResponse)
        Copy an http response.

        This can be used for response transformation, for example to add headers/cookies. The origin response is treated as read-only and will not be modified.

      • headers

        public HeaderMap headers()
        Get the headers.

        The returned map is mutable; the response producer can manipulate it at will. See also header(name,value).

        Specified by:
        headers in interface HttpResponse

      • cookies

        public ArrayList<Cookie> cookies()
        Get the cookies.

        The returned list is mutable; the response producer can manipulate it at will. See also cookie(name,value,maxAge) and cookie(Cookie).

        Specified by:
        cookies in interface HttpResponse
        See Also:

      • header

        public HttpResponseImpl header(String name,
                               String value)
        Set a header.

        If value==null, the header will be removed.

      • cookie

        public HttpResponseImpl cookie(String name,
                               String value,
                               Duration maxAge)
        Add a cookie.

        This method is equivalent to cookie(new Cookie(name, value, maxAge)). Note that the cookie domain=null, path="/". See Cookie.Cookie(String, String, Duration) and cookie(Cookie).

        Example usage: resp.cookie("name","value",Cookie.SESSION)

        Returns:
        this

      • cookie

        public HttpResponseImpl cookie(Cookie cookie)
        Add a cookie.

        If this response already contains a cookie with the same {domain,path,name} identity, that cookie will be removed.

        Returns:
        this
